Goldman Sachs.eligibility: Final year and pre-final year students [1]
Goldman Sachs.preparation strategy: Watch channel videos detailing the specific hiring process [1]

Myntra.program: Myntra Hacker Ramp (Women) & Myntra Ramp Up (All) [2]
Myntra.Key note/How to prepare: Hacker Ramp is specifically for women candidates [2]
Myntra.preparation strategy: Review previous process videos to understand the timeline [3]

GSOC (Google Summer of Code).Key note/How to prepare: Tag is highly valued by recruiters and interviewers [4]
GSOC (Google Summer of Code).preparation strategy: Watch videos from successful candidates who cracked GSOC [3]

Uber.preparation strategy: Focus heavily on Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) [4]

Flipkart.program: Flipkart Grid, Runway, and Girls Who Code [4, 5]
Flipkart.eligibility: All students (Grid); Women only (Runway & Girls Who Code) [4, 5]
Flipkart.Key note/How to prepare: Grid is a major challenge open to everyone [5]
Flipkart.preparation strategy: Utilize resources from previous winners provided in video descriptions [5]

EY.Key note/How to prepare: Hiring is often project or case study based [6]
EY.preparation strategy: Watch specific guides on the process and how to crack the Techathon [6]

Microsoft.Key note/How to prepare: Focuses on mentorship rather than just direct hiring [7]
Microsoft.preparation strategy: Keep a close eye on opening windows to secure a spot [7]

JP Morgan.preparation strategy: Watch interviews with winners and employees from previous years [8]

Adobe.preparation strategy: Prepare for standard product-based company interview rounds [9]
